info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 2:34PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL FAYETTE, EASTERN HIGHLAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 233 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Hillsboro, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Greenfield, Leesburg, Marshall, Bainbridge, Rocky Fork Point, Highland Holiday, Russell, New Market, South Salem, Rocky Fork Lake, East Monroe, Samantha, Rainsboro, Paint Creek State Park, Berrysville, New Martinsburg and Highland County Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
